security: Disclosing this information could reveal intelligence-gathering methods. For example, it exposes how communications from a Bolivian UN ambassador were intercepted and disseminated, potentially impacting diplomatic relations and revealing NSA's surveillance capabilities.
summary: This top-secret NSA cable relays a suggestion from the Bolivian UN Ambassador, Caballero Tamayo, to initiate conversations with countries to donate a mausoleum or sculptural allegory on the Alliance for Progress for President John F. Kennedy's tomb.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 4, 1963, the NSA disseminated a top-secret cable (3/0/BVD/T225-63) that originated from New York, where Bolivian UN Ambassador Caballero Tamayo sent a message (Nr: 202) on November 23, 1963, to the Foreign Ministry in La Paz, suggesting that Bolivia initiate conversations with other countries in the hemisphere to donate a mausoleum or sculptural allegory on the Alliance for Progress for the tomb of President Kennedy, following his assassination.
title: Bolivian UN Ambassador Suggests Alliance for Progress Sculpture for Kennedy Tomb
